anip.mediancut
Class ColorCuboid

java.lang.Object
  anip.mediancut.ColorCuboid
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArrayColorCuboid, ListColorCuboid
public abstract class ColorCuboid
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a subspace of the RGB color space. Used in creating an indexed palette by median cut method.

Author:
Artturi Tilanterä

Constructor Summary
ColorCuboid()
          Constructs a new ColorCuboid.
ColorCuboid(int minR, int minG, int minB, int maxR, int maxG, int maxB)
          Constructs a new ColorCuboid.
 
Method Summary
abstract  void getColor(short[] palette, int index)
          Writes weighted average of colors contained by this cuboid into the specified palette.
abstract  int getMedian(int axis)
          Returns median of the points along the specified axis.
 int longestSide()
          Returns longest side meaning one of the proportions {R, G, B} which is the largest.
abstract  void minimize()
          Minimizes the size of the cuboid so that the faces of the cuboid touch the outermost color occurrences in the RGB subspace contained by the cuboid.
abstract  ColorCuboid newInstance()
          Creates a new instance.
 void setProportions(int minR, int minG, int minB, int maxR, int maxG, int maxB)
           
abstract  ColorCuboid split(int axis, int point)
          Splits the cuboid at the plane towards the axis and at the specified point at that axis.
 int volume()
          Returns volume of this cuboid.

Constructor Detail

ColorCuboid

public ColorCuboid()
Constructs a new ColorCuboid. Initial size is (0, 0, 0) - (255, 255, 255).

ColorCuboid

public ColorCuboid(int minR,
                   int minG,
                   int minB,
                   int maxR,
                   int maxG,
                   int maxB)
Constructs a new ColorCuboid.

Parameters:
minR - smallest value of red contained by the cuboid.
minG - smallest value of green contained by the cuboid.
minB - smallest value of blue contained by the cuboid.
maxR - greatest value of red contained by the cuboid.
maxG - greatest value of green contained by the cuboid.
maxB - greatest value of blue contained by the cuboid.
Method Detail

setProportions

public void setProportions(int minR,
                           int minG,
                           int minB,
                           int maxR,
                           int maxG,
                           int maxB)

minimize

public abstract void minimize()
Minimizes the size of the cuboid so that the faces of the cuboid touch the outermost color occurrences in the RGB subspace contained by the cuboid.

volume

public int volume()
Returns volume of this cuboid. Min and max values are included in the lengths of the sides of the cuboid.

Returns:
volume in RGB space.

longestSide

public int longestSide()
Returns longest side meaning one of the proportions {R, G, B} which is the largest.

Returns:
0 if R, 1 if G, 2 if B.

getMedian

public abstract int getMedian(int axis)
Returns median of the points along the specified axis.

Parameters:
axis - 0 if R, 1 if G, 2 if B.
Returns:
median

split

public abstract ColorCuboid split(int axis,
                                  int point)
Splits the cuboid at the plane towards the axis and at the specified point at that axis.

Parameters:
axis - 0 if R, 1 if G, 2 if B.
point - where to split. Its value has to be between min and max points of the cuboid along the correspongind axis.
Returns:
the other half of splitted cuboid.

getColor

public abstract void getColor(short[] palette,
                              int index)
Writes weighted average of colors contained by this cuboid into the specified palette.

Parameters:
palette - RGB palette. Data in order RGB RGB RGB..
index - Index number of color, 0..255.

newInstance

public abstract ColorCuboid newInstance()
Creates a new instance. Actual implementation MUST copy the reference(s) to color occurrences in color space. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Factory_method_pattern
